{"comments": {"id": 25217, "count": 140, "talk_id": 1944}, "threadId": 25217, "requested_language_english_name": "English", "current_talk": "1944", "description": "Are the simplest phones the smartest? While the rest of the world is updating statuses and playing games on smartphones, Africa is developing useful SMS-based solutions to everyday needs, says journalist Toby Shapshak. In this eye-opening talk, Shapshak explores the frontiers of mobile invention in Africa as he asks us to reconsider our preconceived notions of innovation.", "event": "TEDGlobal 2013", "language": "en", "language_swap": false, "name": "Toby Shapshak: You don't need an app for that", "slug": "toby_shapshak_you_don_t_need_an_app_for_that", "series_slug": null, "speakers": [{"id": "1614", "slug": "toby_shapshak", "is_published": true, "firstname": "Toby", "lastname": "Shapshak", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Technology writer", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/f8cbae0e5d57344c31063f74dca74d90a0141d67_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "Toby reigns supreme as the major talking head for everthing and anything tech.", "whotheyare": "The publisher and editor of Stuff magazine, Toby Shapshak is a South African writer focusing on innovation \u2014 and the role it plays in Africa. ", "whylisten": "

Casual readers of Stuff magazine, with its smart and provocative gadget reviews, might not know the glossy comes from not London or New York but offices in South Africa. Toby Shapshak leads the magazine and news site; he's been called "the most high-profile technology journalist in the country" by GQ South Africa. Formerly a senior newspaper reporter covering everything from crime to politics, Shapshak shadowed Nelson Mandela when he was president, and covered the work of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission after the abolition of apartheid.  

He's been writing about innovation, telecommunications and the Internet — and the impact they have on people's lives — for more than 15 years. He's now working on a book about a passionately held belief: that in Africa, necessity is the mother of innovation.

Do business here", "duration": 1213.0, "slug": "ngozi_okonjo_iweala_on_doing_business_in_africa", "viewed_count": 1238627}, {"id": "232", "hero": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/34910_480x360.jpg", "speaker": "Neil Turok", "title": "My wish: Find the next Einstein in Africa", "duration": 1490.0, "slug": "neil_turok_makes_his_ted_prize_wish", "viewed_count": 544505}, {"id": "523", "hero": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/d9441da0244acb76f766b462f1674d4310cc6fd9_1600x1200.jpg", "speaker": "Erik Hersman", "title": "Reporting crisis via texting", "duration": 236.0, "slug": "erik_hersman_on_reporting_crisis_via_texting", "viewed_count": 436663}, {"id": "154", "hero": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/13909_480x360.jpg", "speaker": "Euvin Naidoo", "title": "Why invest in Africa", "duration": 1141.0, "slug": "euvin_naidoo_on_investing_in_africa", "viewed_count": 447866}, {"id": "1770", "hero": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/b2dc8e60a1f11d3138c4943b91756f2bb6703ff9_1600x1200.jpg", "speaker": "Juliana Rotich", "title": "Meet BRCK, Internet access built for Africa", "duration": 573.0, "slug": "juliana_rotich_meet_brck_internet_access_built_for_africa", "viewed_count": 654272}], "slug": "toby_shapshak_you_don_t_need_an_app_for_that", "speakers": [{"id": "1614", "slug": "toby_shapshak", "is_published": true, "firstname": "Toby", "lastname": "Shapshak", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Technology writer", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/f8cbae0e5d57344c31063f74dca74d90a0141d67_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "Toby reigns supreme as the major talking head for everthing and anything tech.", "whotheyare": "The publisher and editor of Stuff magazine, Toby Shapshak is a South African writer focusing on innovation \u2014 and the role it plays in Africa. ", "whylisten": "

Casual readers of Stuff magazine, with its smart and provocative gadget reviews, might not know the glossy comes from not London or New York but offices in South Africa. Toby Shapshak leads the magazine and news site; he's been called "the most high-profile technology journalist in the country" by GQ South Africa. Formerly a senior newspaper reporter covering everything from crime to politics, Shapshak shadowed Nelson Mandela when he was president, and covered the work of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission after the abolition of apartheid.  

He's been writing about innovation, telecommunications and the Internet — and the impact they have on people's lives — for more than 15 years. He's now working on a book about a passionately held belief: that in Africa, necessity is the mother of innovation. 

"}], "speaker_name": "Toby Shapshak", "tags": ["Africa", "innovation", "technology"], "title": "You don't need an app for that", "video_type": {"id": "1", "name": "TED Stage Talk"}, "viewed_count": 1517795}]}
